## Challenge-Based Solicitation (CBS) - Password Manager Tool

### Overview

The Shared Services Canada (SSC) is issuing a challenge-based solicitation for the procurement of a password manager tool, as outlined in the solicitation document.

### Problem Statement

The SSC lacks a secure, cloud-based password manager solution that is easy to deploy, user-friendly, and provides recovery options. The detailed problem statement and minimum viable requirements can be found in Attachment A - Statement of Challenge (SoC).

### Procurement Process

This challenge-based solicitation is one of the contracting mechanisms employed by the SSC under their Agile Procurement Process 3.0 (APP3.0). The APP3.0 process utilizes flexible contracting mechanisms to improve the ability of Canada to move quickly and produce better results.

### Collaboration with Technation

The SSC is collaborating with Technation, a organization that enables technology companies to showcase their areas of specialization and experience. This collaboration aims to improve Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) access to SSC's procurements and provide government with greater visibility into rapidly evolving technology solutions.

### Scope of Work

The scope of work includes the procurement of a password manager tool that meets the minimum viable requirements outlined in the SoC. The solution must be secure, easy to deploy, user-friendly, and provide recovery options.

### Trade Agreements

This solicitation is subject to the following trade agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement, Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP), and World Trade Organization-Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-GPA).

### Language

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

### Negotiations

The SSC retains the right to negotiate with bidders on any procurement.

### Contact Information

For any inquiries or questions, please submit your request to the email address: coeaip-ceaan@ssc-spc.gc.ca with the file number R000127723.

### Timeline

* Solicitation Closing: December 15, 2022 at 15:00
* Bilingual Information Webinar: October 25, 2022 at 13:30 HAE
